IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: UW-Platteville Foundation, Inc. exists exclusively for the benefit of the University of Wisconsin - Platteville. Its specific role is to provide supplemental funds to aid UW-Platteville in fulfilling its mission successfully. The Foundation is involved in fund raising, fund management, and fund disbursement.
IRS990.MissionDescription: UW-Platteville Foundation, Inc. exists exclusively for the benefit of the University of Wisconsin - Platteville. Its specific role is to provide supplemental funds to aid UW-Platteville in fulfilling its mission successfully. The Foundation is involved in fund raising, fund management, and fund disbursement.
IRS990.Description: ENDOWMENT FUND - GRANT SCHOLARSHIPS AND PROVIDE OTHER SERVICES TO THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN - PLATTEVILLE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The UW-Platteville Foundation's endowments consist of 422 funds established to support a variety of scholarships and development activities at UW-Platteville.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Foundation adopted the requirements for accounting for uncertain tax positions on July 1, 2009. The Foundation determined that it was not required to record a liability related to uncertain tax positions as a result of implementing the new requirements. The federal tax returns of the Foundation for 2006, 2007, and 20008 are subject to examiniation by the IRS, generally for the three years after they were filed.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: For Fine Arts Grants, the Foundation provides the Fine Arts Committee with the dollar amount available for fine arts grants and the criteria for awarding from the specific funds. The committee then solicits grant requests and meets to review and make their selection. Documentation related to the grantees' eligibility and the selection criteria used to award the grants would be the responsibility of the committee. The committee notifies the Foundation in writing regarding what grants have been approved. Actual expenses are paid by the University and, after the "event" is complete, the event manager must request the grant monies from the Foundation. The request must include the University's account detail as well as any other documentation needed to prove that criteria have been met. For example, to satisfy a recognition requirement, a copy of the program and/or any advertisements must accompany the request for payment. Foundation records would indicate which grants had been paid and when. For scholarships, the Foundation provides the various scholarship committees with the dollar amount available for scholarships and the criteria for awarding from the specific funds. The committee then reviews scholarship applications and make their selections. Documentation related to the recipients' eligibility and the specific selection criteria used to award the scholarships would be the responsibility of the committee. The committee notifies the Financial Aid office regarding the selected recipients. The Financial Aid office notifies the recipients, compiles the list of recipients and forwards it to the Foundation. The Foundation forwards payment to the Cashiers office to be applied to the individual account.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Two of UW-Platteville's officers will review and sign Form 990 before it is filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board members are rquired to complete disclosure statemetns annually.
Officers and other board members are not compensated.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Any requests are directed to the Guidestar website or a copy is provided to them.
